educationConsulting.title: Education Consulting
educationConsulting.description: Our international education consultants recommend study destinations and programs tailored to your academic goals, language level, and budget.

schoolSelection.title: School Selection
schoolSelection.description: We work as official agents with 150+ programs across 4 countries, handling school enrollment and official invitation letters.

visaService.title: Full Visa Application Service
visaService.description: We analyze your documents in detail and prepare your application with professional visa advice to minimize risk. We also provide certified translations for visa letters and other required documents.

financialDocs.title: Financial Document Advice
financialDocs.description: We provide professional advice on tuition, living costs, bank statements, and sponsor income documents to meet embassy requirements.

q1.question: Which countries can I study in?
q1.answer: Through our center you can study in Ireland, New Zealand, China, and the USA.

q2.question: Can I work while studying?
q2.answer: In Ireland and New Zealand, students can work legally while studying. Through Work & Travel USA you can work in America during summer and improve your English.

q3.question: Do you provide school acceptance letters?
q3.answer: Yes. We recommend schools that match your goals and language level, and we handle the official acceptance and visa process.

q4.question: Do I need to pay tuition in advance?
q4.answer: It depends on the school and country. Some require advance payment; in other cases you can pay after receiving your visa.

q5.question: Is an English test score required?
q5.answer: It depends on your program. Language courses usually don't require a score; colleges and universities may require IELTS or other English test results.

q6.question: How long does the visa take?
q6.answer: Visa processing time depends on the country and season. On average it takes 4–8 weeks.

q7.question: What support do you provide after the visa?
q7.answer: After the visa we provide practical advice on accommodation, insurance, flights, and living in the country.

q8.question: What if my visa is refused?
q8.answer: We analyze the refusal reasons in detail and advise professionally on reapplying or appealing.

usa.name: USA
usa.description: Study in the land of opportunities
usa.longText: Our organization has been successfully running the Work & Travel USA program since 2023. The program is an official cultural exchange for university students. Students can work in the USA for 3–4 months during summer, earn income, improve their English, and learn about different cultures.

ireland.name: Ireland
ireland.description: Experience quality education in a welcoming country
ireland.longText: Ireland is the only English-speaking country in the EU and is one of the most popular destinations for international students, offering the chance to work while studying. The Irish government grants 1-year post-study work for bachelor's and 2 years for master's graduates. We have successfully processed 1100+ student visas to 5 cities since 2020.

china.name: China
china.description: Study in the heart of academic excellence
china.longText: China is a world leader in education, technology, and economy, with top universities and quality programs. It is known for scholarships, research, and innovation. Scholarship programs for Mongolian students are very open, making China an excellent choice for high school graduates.

newzealand.name: New Zealand
newzealand.description: Study in the land of opportunities
newzealand.longText: New Zealand is one of the safest, most peaceful, and student-friendly countries, ranking 7th globally for education quality. It supports international students with policies that allow working while studying and entering the job market after graduation. We especially recommend New Zealand for those who want to study language and later live and study with their family.
